error.signature: remote: Support for password authentication was removed. Please use a personal access token instead.

verdict.summary: Git HTTPS authentication failed because password-based authentication was deprecated by major hosts (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket). A personal access token or SSH key is required instead.

dead_ends.action: Repeatedly entering the same username/password when prompted
dead_ends.why_fails: Password authentication is permanently disabled on the remote; no password will be accepted regardless of correctness

dead_ends.action: Clearing the credential cache expecting it to fix the issue
dead_ends.why_fails: The problem is not cached bad credentials; the authentication method itself (password) is no longer accepted by the server

workarounds.action: Generate a personal access token and use it as the password
workarounds.how: Generate a PAT on the platform (GitHub: Settings > Developer Settings > Personal Access Tokens). Use the token as the password when prompted. Store it with: git config --global credential.helper store (or cache).
Generate SSH key: ssh-keygen -t ed25519. Add to agent: ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519. Add public key to the platform. Change remote: git remote set-url origin git@github.com:user/repo.git

leads_to.condition: when switching to SSH without properly configuring SSH keys
when credential helpers interfere with HTTPS connections

preceded_by.condition: when access issues are actually authentication failures misreported as connectivity problems

frequently_confused_with.distinction: credential-rejected is HTTPS auth failure; permission-denied-publickey is SSH auth failure. Different protocols, different fix paths.
